column1: It looks for antibodies that are present in the blood of people who may have the disease.
The RPR test can be used to screen for syphilis.
It is used to screen people who have symptoms of sexually transmitted infections and is routinely used to screen pregnant women for the disease.
If the screening test is positive, the next step is to confirm the diagnosis with a more specific test for syphilis, such as FTA-ABS.
The FTA-ABS test will help distinguish between syphilis and other infections or conditions.
How well the RPR test can detect syphilis depends on the stage of the infection.
